# disableFlushing()

**Instance Method**

Disables the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/flush()] method for the window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func disableFlushing()
```

## Discussion

If the window is buffered, disabling [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/flush()] prevents drawing from being automatically flushed by the `NSView` `display...` methods from the window’s backing store to the screen. This method permits several views to be drawn before the results are shown to the user.

Flushing should be disabled only temporarily, while the window’s display is being updated. Each `disableFlushWindow` message must be paired with a subsequent [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/enableFlushing()] message. Invocations of these methods can be nested; flushing isn’t reenabled until the last [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/enableFlushing()] message is sent.

## Methods

- **gState()**: Returns the window’s graphics state object.
- **canStoreColor()**: Indicates whether the window has a depth limit that allows it to store color values.
- **enableFlushing()**: Reenables the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/flush()] method for the window after it was disabled through a previous [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/disableFlushing()] message.
- **flush()**: Flushes the window’s offscreen buffer to the screen if the window is buffered and flushing is enabled.
- **flushIfNeeded()**: Flushes the window’s offscreen buffer to the screen if flushing is enabled and if the last [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/flush()] message had no effect because flushing was disabled.
- **menuChanged(_:)**: This method does nothing; it is here for backward compatibility.
- **cacheImage(in:)**: Stores the window’s raster image from a given rectangle expressed in the window’s base coordinate system.
- **restoreCachedImage()**: Splices the window’s cached image rectangles, if any, back into its raster image (and buffer if it has one), undoing the effect of any drawing performed within those areas since they were established using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/cacheImage(in:)].
- **discardCachedImage()**: Discards all of the window’s cached image rectangles.
- **useOptimizedDrawing(_:)**: Specifies whether the window is to optimize focusing and drawing when displaying its views.
- **init(windowRef:)**: Returns a Cocoa window created from a Carbon window.
